intro: Pogonospermum lolioides var. lolioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf pogonospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
